items.description: Loughborough urban watercourses and local tributaries to the River Soar
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  Further rainfall is forecast over the next 2 days.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
The risk of flooding has now reduced.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Marchington Brook, Picknall Brook, Rolleston Brook

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels are below the flood risk threshold.  Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughout this week. 
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Plym, Tory Brook, Long Brook

items.message: The risk of flooding has reduced. River levels have fallen overnight and are returning to normal as the heavy rainfall has passed. There is some further rainfall forecast over the coming days, however, it is not currently expected to cause river levels to rise significantly again. We will continue to monitor levels closely. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.

floodArea.county: Birmingham, Dudley, Sandwell, Solihull, Walsall, Warwickshire, Wolverhampton

items.message: This flood alert has been issued as heavy rain and thunderstorms have been forecast for this area today and overnight (5 September 2022). There is uncertainty however, over the amount of rainfall expected and the exact location of these thunderstorms and heavy rain. Surface water flooding may affect these areas. We urge you to remain vigilant and avoid walking and driving through flood water. We are continuing to actively monitor the situation closely and will issue updates, and further flood alerts and warnings if necessary. You can monitor your local weather conditions and river levels on the GOV.UK website.
